content.description: SDS on arete, after a couple large moves head out right and wiggle through the right opening.
content.location: Top of the cave on the right.

content.description: The left line of the shared SDS. Start on the arete and work left on slopers to exit through the left hole. Don't dab your back as you squirm out.
content.location: At the top of the cave on the right. Exits through the left opening.

content.description: Back inside the cave lies this stiff one. Sit start on a boulder, hands matched on a ledge. Climb the right leaning column feature. Finish on the chockstone above. Drop off. Would be classic if it topped out.
content.location: The only problem inside the "cave". Right next to the Matador.

content.description:
An excellent problem which is sustained on a flat 40 degree wall with many sidepulls and on great rock! Somewhat comparable to Whispers of Wisdom in RMNP, with its compression moves and highball, slab top out. But, of course it's not THAT good.

 Sit start low on sidepulls, first move is left hand to a slopey crimp. Move straight up towards the jug in the dihedral. Top out up and left on easy terrain.
content.protection: Several pads are nice. Rocky and tiered landing
content.location: Located on the left, steep wall. Just past the small pine trees, but not quite in the cave.

content.description: The Bullpen is a steep wall with two really nice problems. A large boulder abuts it, making it feel like a cave. This wall faces North and sees no sun.
